SHORT_DESCR.P: The Council of Hordaland has decided to extend the existing trolley bus system in Bergen. The Council has decided that the present nº 2 line is to be extended from the city center (Sentrum) to Laksevåg. This constitutes an extension of 5,5 kilometers with parallel operating lines. The project will use hybrid charging buses, enabled for battery-operations, not catenary-only buses.

The line will be established along existing roadways, of which ca. 4,5 kilometers shall be installed with catenary system in both directions. The remaining 1 kilometer in the city center will be operated using the on-board battery reserve.
This project will include the design, supply, installation, testing and commissioning of:
— all associated equipment for the overhead line system,
— 3 substations (rectifiers) for the power supply and all associated cabling.

The Council of Hordaland has decided to extend the existing trolley bus system in Bergen. The Council has decided that the present nº 2 line is to be extended from the city center (Sentrum) to Laksevåg. This constitutes an extension of 5,5 kilometers with parallel operating lines. The project will use hybrid charging buses, enabled for battery-operations, not catenary-only buses.

The line will be established along existing roadways, of which ca. 4,5 kilometers shall be installed with catenary system in both directions. The remaining 1 kilometer in the city center will be operated using the on-board battery reserve.
This project will include the design, supply, installation, testing and commissioning of:
— all associated equipment for the overhead line system,
— 3 substations (rectifiers) for the power supply and all associated cabling.
